intro: Faba vulgaris var. picea, commonly known as the black lentil, is a variety of the broad bean plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dark green to black pods that contain small, angular seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has compound leaves with three leaflets. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is valued for its high protein content and is widely cultivated for both human consumption and animal feed.
